history.content:
I believe the general feeling is that 140 should be a Fall class since 240A -> 240B is a Fall/Spring cycle for all new grad students. Usually it's not a problem to just delay taking it, but it hurts transfer students who can at the earliest take it in Spring and cannot delay it (Pretty sad, right? Alexa....). The usual Spring teachers just would rather teach something else and that leaves no one left to do it.

My suggestion is to take EE142 (Scary!) after 105 + 120. Those two classes should be sufficient to do well enough in 142, and that'll be a good IC class, which you can follow up with 140 in Fall 2019. The material is not really dependent on 140, but it does help. You should be ok. 142 is a bit more of a niche field though. If you don't care about 142 then you have to wait until Fall for 140 unfortunately. I don't think it's gonna happen otherwise.

Unfortunately the 140/240 series is pretty much the main IC series so you're out of luck. There are a couple special topic classes but a lot require 140/142. 

Good luck Adilet ;)

Sooo I was planning to take EE140 over Spring '19, BUT it seems like the class would not be offered during that semester, and I can't take it right now, since EE105, the prereq for 140, is the class that I am currently enrolled in... Alexa, play Despaci... That's why I have few questions! What is going on with EE140 and Spring 2019? Are there any chances that anyone from our smart/beautiful EE instructors would sacrifice their time and effort to teach that class over the spring? If not what would be a solid replacement of 140 (if I want to learn more about analog side of IC's)? Thx in advance!
history.subject: EE140 during Spring 2019
